original_title: Bourse’s robustness boosted by LB Finance’s acquisition of 55.6% stake in Associated Motorways
original_body_lines: Stock market activities continued with their positive proclivities yesterday and a transaction of note was the acquisition of a 55.6 percent stake in Association Motorways Pvt. Ltd by LB Finance. Under this acquisition, LB Finance invested Rs 3.7 billion to purchase 74.3 million shares at a share price of Rs 50. This enabled to increase the business portfolio to a great extent of LB Finance, market analysts said.
Amid those developments both indices moved upwards. The All Share Price Index went up by 77.93 points, while the S and P SL20 rose by 10.95 points. Turnover stood at Rs 6 billion with nine crossings.

Those crossings were; Commercial Bank 1.5 million shares crossed to the tune of Rs 291.5 million; its shares traded at Rs 193.50, LOLC Holdings 95000 shares crossed to the tune of Rs 55.5 million; its shares sold at Rs 580, Hemas Holdings 1.6 million shares crossed to the tune of Rs 52.9 million; its shares traded at Rs 33, HNB (Non- Voting) 168,000 shares crossed for Rs 49.9 million and its shares traded at Rs 297.

JKH 1.4 million shares crossed to the tune of Rs 31.6 million; its shares traded at Rs 22, Sunshine Holdings one million shares crossed for Rs 31 million; its shares sold at Rs 31, CIC Holdings (Non- Voting) 200,000 shares crossed for Rs 24.6 million; its shares sold at Rs 123, Sanasa Developments Bank 500,000 shares crossed to the tune of Rs 23.5 million; its shares sold traded at Rs 47 and Melstacope 125,000 shares crossed for Rs 20.8 million; its shares traded at Rs 157.

In the retail market top seven companies that mainly contributed to the turnover were; Hemas Holdings Rs 448.7 million (13.5 million shares traded), Melstacope Rs 359 million (2.1 million shares traded), Commercial Bank Rs 292 million (1.5 million shares traded), JKH Rs 241 million (10.9 million shares traded), CIC Holdings Rs 217 million (1.35 million shares traded), Dipped Products Rs 191 million (2.8 million shares traded) and HNB (Non- Voting) Rs 155 million (521,000 shares traded). During the day 148 million share volumes changed hands in 38000 transactions.
It said that the banking sector performed well, especially Commercial Bank, while the manufacturing sector, especially JKH, performed well during the day.
Yesterday, the rupee opened at Rs 302.60/63 to the US dollar, weaker from Rs 302.50/55 the previous day, while bond yields were broadly steady, dealers said.
A bond maturing on 15.12.2026 was quoted at 8.25/30 percent, down from 8.25/32 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 was quoted at 8.70/80 percent, down from 8.70/82 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.12.2028 was quoted flat at 9.10/15 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.12.2029 was quoted at 9.50/60 percent, up from 9.52/56 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.07.2030 was quoted flat at 9.70/75 percent, from 9.70/75 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.12.2032 was quoted at 10.45/50 percent, up from 10.43/47 percent.

The telegraphic transfer rates for the American dollar was 299.0000 buying, 306.0000 selling; the British pound was 397.8953 buying, and 409.2571 selling, and the euro was 346.5991 buying, 357.9623 selling.
